items.prompt: Define normative social influence and provide an example.
keyPoints: Normative social influence involves conforming to be liked or accepted by a group
It is driven by the desire to fit in
Example: agreeing with friends' opinions to avoid rejection

items.prompt: Explain the concept of informational social influence.
keyPoints: Informational social influence is conforming because we believe others have more knowledge
It occurs in ambiguous situations
Example of using others' answers in a test situation

markingCriteria.full: Includes all key points with accurate detail
markingCriteria.partial: Includes 1-2 key points or lacks detail

items.prompt: Evaluate the ecological validity of Asch's conformity study using the PEEL structure.
keyPoints: Point: Asch's study has low ecological validity
Evidence: Conducted in an artificial setting using line judgment tasks
Explanation: These tasks do not reflect real-world social situations
Link: Thus, findings may not generalize to everyday conformity
